content.description: This is a good climb to get the rope above Good Morning America and Edge of Night.  One can TR both routes from the top.
content.protection: Standard trad with with emphasis on small to medium pro and a dozen two foot draws.
content.location: Climb the major right to left weakness a bit uphill of Good Morning America.  Traverse right below a small tree to the anchors for Good Morning America (rap this route, trend right to a ledge with a 60m rope then down climb a bit).

content.description: The crux is relatively near the ground where the crack trends vertical.  Generally follow the crack system from left to right, climb straight up and then cross into the obvious dihedral near the end of the climb.  Do not cross into the obvious shallow dihedral too low.
content.protection: Standard trad rack.  Rap the route (trend right to a ledge with a 60m rope then down climb a bit) from rap hangers at the end of the pitch.
content.location: Third class up a bit until one is below the left to right dihedral crack.

content.description: There are two cruxes on the route.  The first crux is surmounting the roof at the bottom of the climb at the third bolt.  The second crux, after a rest, is on the upper technical face around the sixth bolt.
content.protection: Bolts to an anchor with chains.
content.location: Third class up a bit to the belay below a small roof.  The climb goes up the slab and right to the crux then a rest and finishes on the clean face to the right of the large right facing dihedral.

content.description: Good longer moderate route.  Several small cruxes, the start and the top third off the route with easier runs in the middle.
content.protection: 12 bolts, six draws should be two foot for the center and the end of the route.  Climb to the Good Morning America rap hangers.  One can TR, from the ground, the route with a 70m rope.
content.location: Begin on a slab downhill and slightly left of Good Morning America.  Rap the route with a 70 m rope (trend right to a ledge with a 60m rope then down climb a bit).

content.description: This is the rock across from the parking just upstream of the second tunnel.  The rock is black rather than brown and contains a large right facing dihedral system.
